title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A young girl growing up in the racially charged American South learns about justice, empathy, and human dignity.

author: George Orwell
summary: A bleak depiction of a totalitarian future under a regime that surveils and controls every aspect of life.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A spirited young woman navigates social expectations and family obligations in search of true love.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A mysterious millionaire's tragic pursuit of love and the American Dream during the Jazz Age.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: The epic tale of a ship captain's obsessive quest to capture the elusive white whale, Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: A sweeping novel that chronicles the lives of Russian nobility against the backdrop of the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: The story of a disaffected teenage boy navigating the trials of adolescence and identity.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A hobbit's adventure across Middle-earth in a quest to retrieve a treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
summary: An orphaned governess finds love and uncovers dark secrets in the halls of Thornfield Hall.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: The psychological journey of a man who commits murder and the torment he suffers as a result.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
summary: The ancient Greek epic tale of Odysseus's journey home following the Trojan War.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic adventure of a hobbit and his companions as they strive to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle-earth.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
summary: A story of love, sacrifice, and redemption set against the turbulent times of the French Revolution.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: A dystopian vision of a society driven by technology, genetic engineering, and total social control.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
summary: An allegorical journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven guided by the poet Virgil and Dante's love, Beatrice.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
summary: A scientist's ambition leads him to create life, with devastating consequences for him and his creation.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A man trades his soul to retain his youth and beauty, as his portrait ages in his stead.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: A tragic story of love, marriage, and societal expectations in imperial Russia.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
summary: The classic horror tale of the vampire Count Dracula and his pursuit of power in Victorian England.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: A philosophical novel exploring the lives and struggles of three brothers in a Russian family.
